intro: Monotes gossweileri, commonly known as the Gossweiler's monotes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in shrublands and grasslands. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
